title: UK Language Solutions Introduces Accessorix v2.0 - The New Translation Booking and Project Management System
text: UK Language Solutions Introduces Accessorix v2.0 - The New Translation Booking and Project Management System Accessorix enables clients to book a translator or interpreter within seconds anywhere in the world. STOKE-ON-TRENT, ENGLAND, October 22,   UK Language Solutions announces the launch of Accessorix v2.0 - the updated online booking and project management system that allows clients to book a translator or interpreter anywhere in the world. Devised and implemented by UK Language Solutions' very own in-house IT team, Accessorix is the only booking and project management portal of its kind in the translation industry today. Ideal for busy executives on the go, whether in the car, at home, on the train or at the airport, clients simply log in to their Accessorix v2.0 account where they can book a translator or interpreter within seconds, request a quote or check their invoices. Designed by one of the UK's most progressive translation providers in response to growing market demand, Accessorix is a highly responsive order management system that is fully protected with 128 bit SSL (secure socket layer) technology, allowing clients to get translation projects moving quickly while getting on with other important tasks at the same time. As well as being completely free to all clients, Accessorix is a fast and efficient way of keeping track of all online bookings, invoices and payments in one handy, easy to access account area. Each time clients make a booking through Accessorix they are guaranteed of making a saving of GBP25, meaning they will save GBP250 on every 10 bookings. To register for a new, online account, all clients need to do is visit https://accessorix.co.uk where they can apply for a unique user name and password within minutes. Once registered, clients will have immediate access to their bespoke dashboard area where they can view all current bookings this month, the previous month, and all bookings for the year to date in addition to all current and historical invoices. Clients can also choose to view their orders and invoices by department or organisation as a whole, giving them that extra bit of flexibility to see what's going on outside their immediate area. The project management aspect of Accessorix enables clients to monitor orders weekly, monthly or quarterly and track expenditure by project, language or client. As well as assisting them with management forecasting and budgeting, our useful project management tool allows clients to investigate inter-departmental and company-wide expenditure making Accessorix extremely versatile. Designed totally with the needs of the user in mind, Accessorix allows clients to create individual or multiple user accounts, set account permissions for individual, group or corporate-wide access while permitting clients the benefits of a secure login where they dictate what others can see. Low cost, quick and easy to integrate within an existing IT system, Accessorix is highly flexible and is now available via a multi-media platform, including laptop, desktop, tablet, iphone or android mobile in a few simple steps! For more information on Accessorix , please contact Emma Edgeley, Marketing & Business Development Manager on 0800 7565 210 or email: emma@uklanguagesolutions.co.uk or visit our website http://uklanguagesolutions.co.uk UK Language Solutions is a quality, low cost provider of translation and interpreting services in over 350 world and rare languages to both public and private sectors across the UK and world-wide. Whatever the requirement, from a face to face interpreter, telephonic interpreter, court interpreter, or conference interpreter, we have over 10,000 experienced translators and interpreters who have the skills and expertise to assist our clients' communication needs within their desired timeframe. Many of our interpreters are registered with leading bodies such as NRPSI (National Register of Public Sector Interpreting) and CIOL (Chartered Institute of Linguists) and have a minimum of 3 years interpreting experience having supported a wide range of clients from SME's, manufacturers, blue chip firms, FTSE top 100 firms, and multinationals all over the world. # # #
